0: A fundus photograph showing a healthy retina with no signs of diabetic retinopathy.

1: Fundus photograph showing mild nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy.
Retinal image with few microaneurysms indicating mild diabetic retinopathy.
Fundus scan demonstrating early signs of diabetic retinopathy with scattered microaneurysms.
Mild diabetic retinopathy with minimal retinal changes.
Early stage diabetic retinopathy fundus image with few abnormalities.
2: Fundus photograph showing moderate nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy.
Retinal image with multiple microaneurysms and dot hemorrhages.
Moderate diabetic retinopathy with visible hard exudates and hemorrhages.
Fundus scan showing moderate diabetic eye disease with scattered retinal lesions.
Moderate stage diabetic retinopathy with significant microaneurysms.
3: Fundus photograph showing severe nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy.
Retinal image with extensive hemorrhages and venous beading.
Severe diabetic retinopathy with intraretinal microvascular abnormalities.
Fundus scan demonstrating severe diabetic changes requiring close monitoring.
Advanced nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy with numerous hemorrhages.
4: Fundus photograph showing proliferative diabetic retinopathy.
Retinal image with neovascularization and abnormal blood vessel growth.
Proliferative diabetic retinopathy with new vessel formation.
Advanced diabetic retinopathy fundus scan with vitreous hemorrhage risk.
Severe proliferative diabetic eye disease requiring urgent treatment.
